body_html: I think it is a convenience issue: if your computation is already expressed in the complex dtype getting a norm you cannot pass to the same ops as your complex number is likely to lead to more bugs than not, and getting the real part of a complex tensor is easy if you do want to do it.
body_text: I think it is a convenience issue: if your computation is already expressed in the complex dtype getting a norm you cannot pass to the same ops as your complex number is likely to lead to more bugs than not, and getting the real part of a complex tensor is easy if you do want to do it.
body: I think it is a convenience issue: if your computation is already expressed in the complex dtype getting a norm you cannot pass to the same ops as your complex number is likely to lead to more bugs than not, and getting the real part of a complex tensor is easy if you do want to do it.
